intro: Wenderothia, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Wenderothia species often have hairy leaves and produce yellow or white flowers. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
